news_headline: Akali Dal MLAs suspended from Punjab Assembly till end of Budget session
news_article: Members of the Shiromani Akali Dal were on Friday suspended for the remaining part of the Punjab Assembly's Budget session, which is to end on March 10, for disrupting the proceedings. Marshals evicted the suspended MLAs from the House. They shouted slogans in the well of the House when Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh was replying to the Governor's address.

news_headline: 25 students of Raj govt boarding school test positive for COVID-19
news_article: As many as 25 students and three staff members of a residential government school for differently-abled children were among 28 people to test positive for COVID-19 in Rajasthan's Udaipur on Friday. Udaipur Chief Medical Health Officer (CMHO) Dr Dinesh Kharadi said that 80 students and 10 staff members of the school were tested after a teacher tested positive for coronavirus.

news_headline: IndiGo passenger says he's COVID-19 +ve just before take-off; all flyers offloaded
news_article: A passenger on a Pune-bound IndiGo flight at Delhi airport informed the crew on board on Thursday that he tested positive for COVID-19, an IndiGo official said. "The flight was reported to be delayed for about two hours...The pilot of the aircraft turned back the flight from the runway to taxi-bay and offloaded all the passengers," the official added.

news_headline: Platform ticket cost hiked temporarily to prevent overcrowding: Railways
news_article: The recent hike in platform ticket cost at some stations is "temporary" and is aimed at preventing overcrowding amid COVID-19, the Railways said on Friday. Saying that there was "nothing new" about the "short-term crowd control measure", Railways added, "Considering the upsurge of COVID-19 in few states, Indian Railway is discouraging people from unnecessary crowding at the platforms."

news_headline: Farmers' protest is India's internal matter: UK govt ahead of debate in Parliament
news_article: Farmers' protest was India's "internal matter" and was for India to resolve, the new British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis said. He said this ahead of a UK Parliament debate on press freedom and safety of protesters in India, scheduled for next Monday. Things happening in India have ripples in UK because of a large Indian diaspora, Ellis said.

news_headline: Owner of car abandoned with explosive material near Ambani's house dies by suicide
news_article: A man named Mansukh Hiren, whose Scorpio car was used to plant gelatin sticks and threat letter near Mukesh Ambani's residence in Mumbai, has been found dead. As per police, Mansukh died by suicide by jumping into Kalwa creek. Mansukh had reportedly told the investigating officials that his car had been stolen.

news_headline: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh takes 1st dose of COVID-19 vaccine
news_article: Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh was administered with the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at Civil Hospital in Mohali on Friday. "I got my first shot of COVID-19 vaccine today. I urge all above 60 years of age or above 45 years with co-morbidities to get the vaccination done as soon as possible," Singh tweeted.

news_headline: 10 first-yr MBBS students test COVID-19 positive in Gujarat's Rajkot
news_article: A total of 10 first-year MBBS students of Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay Medical College in Rajkot tested positive for COVID-19 over the past two days, college dean Dr Mukesh Samani said. He said that on-campus classes for the first-year students were suspended for a week. He also added that a section of COVID-19 hospital was reserved for students' treatment.

news_headline: No govt member in self-regulatory body of OTT platforms: I&B Ministry
news_article: The self-regulatory body formed by over-the-top (OTT) video streaming platforms will not have any member appointed by the government, the Information and Broadcasting Ministry has said. The clarification came during the meeting between I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar and representatives of OTT, following the announcement of digital media guidelines last week.

news_headline: Unprecedented: Fadnavis on vacant Maha Assembly Speaker post
news_article: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said, "It has never happened before that despite the Governor's recommendation, the post of Assembly Speaker is vacant for over a week." He added, "This is equivalent to the failure of constitutional machinery." The post fell vacant after Nana Patole resigned as Speaker on February 4 and took over as Congress' Maharashtra chief.

news_headline: PCMC demolished 254 illegal structures in last 1 month, has 10K more on radar
news_article: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has demolished 254 illegal structures in last one month as part of a drive that started on February 1. Officials said over 10,000 more structures are on their radar. "The demolished structures included commercial shops, tin sheds, hotels, restaurants, private offices and even residential buildings," PCMC official Vijay Bhojane told The Indian Express.

news_headline: Legal action will be initiated against ED officials: Kerala CM
news_article: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan claimed that the Enforcement Directorate (ED) officials have tried to threaten the state government officials and legal action will be initiated against them. Vijayan's statement comes after ED summoned Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board (KIIFB) officials to probe if the state-owned agency violated provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999.

news_headline: Youth launch 'No job, No vote' campaign against Rajasthan govt
news_article: Unemployed youth in Rajasthan have launched a 'No job, No vote' campaign against CM Ashok Gehlot-led government. The Rajasthan Berozgar Ekikrit Mahasangh has started a social media campaign asking youth to vote against the current government in the upcoming by-polls in four constituencies. The by-polls are to be held in four constituencies - Sujangarh, Sahada, Rajsamand and Vallabhnagar.

news_headline: 8 'Naxal couriers' apprehended in Telangana, 350 detonators recovered
news_article: A total of eight people identified as 'Naxal couriers' were arrested in Telangana's Bhadradri Kothagudem district by security forces, the CRPF said. As many as 350 electric detonators, nine liquid gelatin stick wires, a motorcycle and cash were recovered from their possession, added a CRPF officer. They were arrested when CRPF personnel were checking vehicles on that route.

news_headline: Fuel tax cut should be joint call of Centre, states: FM Sitharaman
news_article: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that high petrol and diesel prices are a burden for consumers but a tax cut should be a joint call of the Centre and states. "States are also charging [duties]. When the Centre draws revenue, 41% of it goes to the state," the FM added. According to reports, taxes constitute 60% of the petrol price.

news_headline: Woman dies by suicide in UP's Sambhal after filing rape case: Police
news_article: A woman died by suicide in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district days after filing a rape case against a person, said police. The woman had registered the rape case against a man on January 27 and the accused has been arrested, said a police official. "There was a love affair between the deceased woman and the accused," the official added.

news_headline: Delhi Police issues 468 new arms licenses, renews 6,263 in 2020
news_article: As many as 468 arms licenses were issued, while 6,263 licenses were renewed by Delhi Police's Licensing Unit in 2020, according to data provided by the Delhi Police. Delhi Police cancelled 83 arms licenses and issued 388 casual performance licenses last year. In 2020, 19 lodging licenses for guest houses and hotels were issued, while 587 such licenses were renewed.

news_headline: DRDO conducts successful flight test of Solid Fuel Ducted Ramjet Technology
news_article: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) on Friday successfully carried out a flight demonstration based on Solid Fuel Ducted Ramjet (SFDR) technology from Integrated Test Range in Odisha. All the subsystems, including the booster motor and nozzle-less motor, performed as expected, DRDO said. They added that air launch scenario was simulated using a booster motor during the test.

news_headline: Pokhriyal inaugurates 29th edition of New Delhi World Book Fair
news_article: Union Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank on Friday virtually inaugurated the 29th edition of the annual New Delhi World Book Fair, organised by the National Book Trust (NBT), India. The book fair will be held virtually from March 6-9. Pokhriyal appealed to all students to buy a book for themselves on their birthdays and to also donate one to someone.

news_headline: Submit post-mortem video of man who died in tractor rally: HC to UP Police
news_article: Delhi High Court asked Uttar Pradesh Police to hand over original X-ray plates and video of Navreet Singh's post-mortem to Delhi Police. Singh had died during the tractor rally in Delhi on January 26. While police said that he died because his tractor overturned after crashing into a barrier at ITO, his family claims he was shot by the police.

news_headline: Taapsee's boyfriend tweets to Sports Minister about I-T raid, Rijiju responds
news_article: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju has responded to Taapsee Pannu's boyfriend, badminton coach Mathias Boe's tweet about I-T raids on Taapsee. "Representing India...as...coach, meanwhile I-T department is raiding Taapsee's houses...@KirenRijiju please do something," wrote Mathias. "Law of...land is supreme...Subject matter is beyond [our] domain. We must stick to...professional duties," Rijiju replied.

news_headline: Reliance Industries to cover COVID-19 vaccination costs for employees, families
news_article: Reliance Industries will bear the full cost of COVID-19 vaccination of its employees, their spouses, parents and children, who are eligible, the company's Non-Executive Director Nita Ambani said. In a letter, she urged all employees to register for India's vaccination programme. Earlier, IT companies, including Infosys and Accenture, said that they will bear employees' vaccination costs.

news_headline: US blocking raw materials will hamper global vaccine efforts: Adar Poonawalla
news_article: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla told a World Bank panel that a US law blocking export of raw materials, including bags and filters, will hamper global vaccination efforts. "The Novavax vaccine, which we're a major manufacturer for, needs these items from...US," he added. The US government had invoked the Defense Production Act to prioritise supplies for Pfizer vaccine.

news_headline: Tata Motors to go solo, no tie-up with Tesla for EVs: N Chandrasekaran
news_article: Tata Motors Chairman N Chandrasekaran clarified that there's "no dialogue" with Elon Musk-led Tesla for a partnership in India. "We will do it on our own," he added while speaking of the company's plans for the electric vehicle (EV) segment. In January, a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility had sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla for electric vehicles.

news_headline: Premji's Wipro makes its biggest purchase, buys Capco for $1.45 bn
news_article: Billionaire Azim Premji's IT company Wipro has agreed to acquire London-based consultancy firm Capco for $1.45 billion in its biggest purchase. Capco employs 5,000 consultants and will help the company add banking, insurance and financial services clients, Wipro said. The transaction is expected to close in the quarter ending June 30.

news_headline: Owner of car abandoned with explosive material near Ambani's house dies by suicide
news_article: A man named Mansukh Hiren, whose Scorpio car was used to plant gelatin sticks and threat letter near Mukesh Ambani's residence in Mumbai, has been found dead. As per police, Mansukh died by suicide by jumping into Kalwa creek. Mansukh had reportedly told the investigating officials that his car had been stolen.

news_headline: Govt aims to reduce 6,000 compliance requirements for businesses: PM Modi
news_article: PM Narendra Modi has said that the government is aiming to do away with more than 6,000 compliance requirements for businesses, both at the central and state level. He stated that the government believes that government interference in everything creates more problems rather than solutions. "Therefore, Self-Regulation, Self-Attesting, Self-Certification are being emphasised," PM Modi added.

news_headline: Use cheap oil you bought last year: Saudi as India asks OPEC to ease output cuts
news_article: Saudi Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman has said that India should use the crude that it purchased "very cheaply last year". His comments came after India urged the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) to ease production curbs and fulfil their promise of stable oil prices. On Thursday, OPEC and its allies extended output cuts till April.

news_headline: Elon Musk loses $6.2 billion in a day, no longer world's second richest
news_article: Tesla CEO Elon Musk lost $6.2 billion in a day and slipped to the third position on the world's richest persons list, as per Forbes. Forbes estimates Musk's current net worth at $150.9 billion. French billionaire businessman Bernard Arnault and family have taken over Musk's place with a net worth of $155.6 billion, Forbes added.

news_headline: Allow manufacturing of non-COVID-19 vaccines under clinical trial: SII to PMO
news_article: Serum Institute of India (SII) has written to the PM's Office proposing reforms in the drug regulatory system. A provision, that allowed manufacturing and stockpiling of COVID-19 vaccines during clinical trial, should also be implemented for non-COVID-19 vaccines, SII said. "Because of this...we could make the vaccine [Covishield] available in...a short span of time to protect millions," it added.

news_headline: My duty to appeal: FM after Cairn wins $1.2 bn arbitration award in tax dispute
news_article: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday hinted that the government intends to appeal against an arbitration panel's order asking India to pay over $1.2 billion to UK's Cairn Energy in a tax dispute. "Where I find arbitration award questioning India's sovereign authority to tax...if there is a question about the sovereign right to tax...it's my duty to appeal," she added.

news_headline: India receives highest FDI at $67.5 bn in first nine months of 2020-21
news_article: India received foreign direct investment of $67.5 billion between April and December 2020, marking the highest ever amount for the first nine months of a financial year. The inflows were 22% higher compared to $55.14 billion received during the same period in 2019-20, according to government data. Inflows in December alone jumped 24% to $9.2 billion from a year ago.

news_headline: Blackstone in talks to acquire minority stake in Sify: Report
news_article: US-based Blackstone Group is in exclusive talks to acquire a minority stake in Chennai's Sify Technologies, Bloomberg reported. Sify has sought a valuation of around $1 billion to $1.2 billion in a transaction. However, it is unclear what valuation the Blackstone stake purchase will be struck at and the talks between the firms could still fall apart.

news_headline: SoftBank strategy chief Katsunori Sago to resign on March 31
news_article: SoftBank Group's Chief Strategy Officer Katsunori Sago will be resigning on March 31. Sago joined SoftBank in 2018 from Japan Post and was formerly vice chairman of Goldman Sachs Japan. He was one of the highest-paid executives in SoftBank and earned $10.1 million in the financial year ended March 2020.

news_headline: Wholesale onion prices crash by nearly 50% on higher supplies
news_article: Wholesale prices of onion have crashed by nearly 50% to around ₹2,000 per quintal in key markets across the country during the last 10 days, reports said. The late Kharif crop arrivals have begun in most markets and with the arrival of the summer crop, prices could fall further, National Horticultural Research and Development Foundation's PK Gupta said.

news_headline: Billionaire Lakshmi Mittal's ArcelorMittal plans ₹50,000-cr steel plant in Odisha
news_article: Billionaire Lakshmi Mittal's ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India has signed an MoU to build a steel plant in Odisha's Kendrapara with an investment of nearly ₹50,000 crore, Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik's office tweeted. ArcelorMittal had previously attempted to build a similar plant in the state but ditched the plan in 2013 due to its failure to get suitable land and permits.

news_headline: International oil prices surge after OPEC+ supply restraint
news_article: International oil prices soared over 4% on Thursday after the group of major oil-producing countries OPEC+ extended the current production cuts to April. Benchmark oil index, Brent, on Thursday surged as much as $67.75 a barrel. Earlier, Oil Minister Dharmendra Pradhan urged OPEC+ to ease production cuts. Petrol prices in India have crossed ₹100 per litre in several cities.

news_headline: Government to table bill to ban cryptocurrency: Report
news_article: The government will soon introduce a bill in the Parliament that will ban private cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin, a report has said. A government official reportedly stated that the "introduction of currencies is a sovereign function and it must remain that way". Earlier, RBI had said that cryptocurrencies may impact the financial stability of the country.

news_headline: Canadian firm to build 39 trains for Mumbai Metro Line 4, 4A
news_article: Canadian company Bombardier has been given the contract to manufacture 234 coaches or 39 trains for Metro Line 4 (Wadala to Kasarvadavali) and Metro Line 4A (Kasarvadavali to Gaimukh), Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) said. "The first prototype train is expected to be delivered after 84 weeks from today," MMRDA tweeted on Thursday.

news_headline: Fuel tax cut should be joint call of Centre, states: FM Sitharaman
news_article: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that high petrol and diesel prices are a burden for consumers but a tax cut should be a joint call of the Centre and states. "States are also charging [duties]. When the Centre draws revenue, 41% of it goes to the state," the FM added. According to reports, taxes constitute 60% of the petrol price.

news_headline: Actress Hazel Keech, Yuvraj Singh's wife, goes off social media temporarily
news_article: Actress Hazel Keech, former India cricketer Yuvraj Singh's wife, announced in an Instagram post that she is going off social media temporarily. She wrote, "I know this will come as a shock to most of you, but it's ok, sometimes we need this time apart to remember how to live as individuals rather than being completely dependent on each other."

news_headline: Taapsee's boyfriend tweets to Sports Minister about I-T raid, Rijiju responds
news_article: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju has responded to Taapsee Pannu's boyfriend, badminton coach Mathias Boe's tweet about I-T raids on Taapsee. "Representing India...as...coach, meanwhile I-T department is raiding Taapsee's houses...@KirenRijiju please do something," wrote Mathias. "Law of...land is supreme...Subject matter is beyond [our] domain. We must stick to...professional duties," Rijiju replied.

news_headline: Jaffer trolls Vaughan with 'Hera Pheri' meme after Gavaskar's 'Chal Phut' remark
news_article: Punjab Kings batting coach Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to troll ex-England captain Michael Vaughan and other former England cricketers with a 'Hera Pheri' meme. This comes after ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Indian media should not give importance to their remarks on Indian pitches, adding that, "We should tell them 'Chal Phut'." Jaffer used '#OnOff' to mock Vaughan.

news_headline: 666666 vs bowler who went WWW in last over, madness: Jaffer on Pollard's record
news_article: Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to praise West Indies captain Kieron Pollard for smashing six sixes in an over in a T20I against Sri Lanka. Referring to Pollard achieving the feat against spinner Akila Dananjaya, who had taken a hat-trick in the previous over, Jaffer wrote, "Take a bow...Pollard...666666 vs a bowler who went WWW in his last over!! Madness!"

news_headline: Pant's ton, Sundar's 60* help India take 89-run lead against England after Day 2
news_article: India ended the second day of the fourth Test in Ahmedabad at 294/7, leading England by 89 runs. Wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant slammed 101, while Washington Sundar is unbeaten on 60. Captain Virat Kohli got out for a duck, his second in the series. This is the first time since 2014 that Kohli registered two ducks in a Test series.

news_headline: Anderson becomes first England bowler to take 900 wickets in international cricket
news_article: James Anderson has become the first England bowler to take 900 wickets across formats in international cricket. The 38-year-old achieved the feat after dismissing Ajinkya Rahane on the second day of the fourth Test in Ahmedabad. Overall, he is the sixth bowler to take 900 international wickets after Glenn McGrath, Shane Warne, Muttiah Muralitharan, Anil Kumble and Wasim Akram.

news_headline: England batsman issues clarification over breakfast picture after PCB criticised
news_article: England batsman Alex Hales, who represents Islamabad United in the Pakistan Super League, has issued clarification after Pakistan Cricket Board was criticised in relation with a picture of breakfast shared by Hales. "It was one meal where the order was incorrect...I found it funny, nothing more. The food and hospitality here has been excellent...hope this clears it up," Hales said.

news_headline: Virat Kohli's reaction to Rishabh Pant's hundred goes viral
news_article: Team India captain Virat Kohli's reaction to Rishabh Pant reaching hundred in the fourth Test against England has gone viral. Kohli jumped off his seat and ran towards the dressing room balcony to applaud. Pant slammed 101 runs off 118 deliveries. The hundred is Pant's third in Test cricket and his first international ton on Indian soil.

news_headline: India had a better team in 2012 than the one today: Graeme Swann
news_article: Ex-England spinner Graeme Swann feels that the Indian team he played against in 2012 was way better than the one currently being led by Virat Kohli. "How we beat India back then I’d never know," Swann said. Swann made the comment after ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar called the Virat Kohli-led unit one of the best produced by India in history.

news_headline: Stokes abused me after I bowled a bouncer, I asked Virat bhai to handle it: Siraj
news_article: Following the first day's play in the fourth India-England Test, India fast bowler Mohammed Siraj talked about the verbal fight between Ben Stokes and Virat Kohli. "Stokes abused me after I bowled a bouncer. I informed Kohli and he handled the matter," Siraj said. The umpire had to separate Stokes and Kohli.

news_headline: We should tell them 'Chal Phut': Gavaskar on ex-England players criticising pitches
news_article: Sunil Gavaskar has said that importance should not be given to former England players regarding their take on Indian pitches. "We should tell them 'Chal Phut'. They'll continue making remarks if we keep on giving them importance," he said. He added when India got all out for 36, Australian media did not give importance to opinion of former Indian cricketers.

news_headline: Models were coming, weddings were happening: Akhtar criticises PCB over PSL bubble
news_article: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has criticised Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) over Pakistan Super League (PSL) bubble after the league got postponed due to coronavirus cases in the competition. "Why did PCB not get a specific hotel for all the players?" he asked. He added, "Bubble was being breached, models were coming, weddings were happening, players were taking photos."

news_headline: England bowled out for 205 as Axar, Ashwin take their wicket tally to 49 in the series
news_article: India ended the Day 1 of the fourth Test against England in Ahmedabad at 24/1, trailing England by 181 runs. England were bowled out for 205, with Ravichandran Ashwin and Axar Patel taking seven wickets between them. The spin duo have taken 49 wickets between them in the series so far. India opener Shubman Gill got out for a duck.

news_headline: Virat Kohli's lookalike spotted at Narendra Modi Stadium, pics go viral
news_article: A lookalike of Team India captain Virat Kohli was spotted at the Narendra Modi Stadium during the second day of the fourth Test. Several pictures of the lookalike went viral on social media. Reacting to the picture, a fan tweeted, "Virat Kohli max pro." Another wrote, "This is Virat+Siraj." "He was in Australia too," another fan commented.

news_headline: Rishabh Pant brings up his 1st international hundred in India with a six
news_article: India wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant on Friday smashed his first international hundred in India after reaching the three-figure mark with a six on his 115th delivery in the first innings of the fourth Test against England. Pant has now scored three Test hundreds. His first two hundreds, both scored abroad, had come against England and Australia in 2018 and 2019 respectively.

news_headline: Rohan Gavaskar responds after man tweets 'Daddy quota still works' on pic
news_article: Ex-cricketer Rohan Gavaskar has responded to a man who commented 'Daddy quota still works' on his picture in a bus with 'India Legends' team that is participating in Road Safety World Series. "Is that how you got into your school?" Rohan wrote. "I feel sorry for your parents....Imagine how they must feel knowing their son is a troll," he added.

news_headline: England batsman Alex Hales trolls Pakistan Cricket Board with pic of breakfast
news_article: England batsman Alex Hales took to Instagram to share a picture of the breakfast provided to him in Pakistan. Hales, who was representing Islamabad United in Pakistan Super League 2021, indirectly trolled Pakistan Cricket Board for the quality of food. He captioned it, "Toast, omelette and baked beans." However, there was no omelette in the picture.

news_headline: Pak's Shadab tweets 'Ya Allah, who jinxed our PSL?' after postponement, fans react
news_article: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan, who represents Islamabad United in Pakistan Super League (PSL), reacted to the tournament being postponed due to COVID-19 cases. He tweeted, "Ya Allah humary PSL ko kis ke nazar laga de (Ya Allah, who jinxed our PSL?)" Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "They call him Dale Steyn." "International cricketers shouldn't tweet such things," wrote another.

news_headline: Won’t allow players to travel if quarantine is needed: Liverpool manager Klopp
news_article: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has said that he won't allow his players to travel to international matches this month if they need to quarantine on return. "We've to admit the players are paid by the clubs so it means we have to be first priority," Klopp said. Currently, Britain has 10-day quarantine rule for people travelling from "red list" countries.

news_headline: Amazon to stream NFL's Thursday Night games exclusively in $1-bn deal: Report
news_article: Amazon and US' National Football League (NFL) are close to signing a deal that gives Amazon exclusive streaming rights to a "significant number" of Thursday Night games on Prime Video, The Wall Street Journal reported. Amazon could reportedly pay up to $1 billion per year for the rights. Amazon-owned Twitch has made deals with the NBA and Formula One.

news_headline: US blocking raw materials will hamper global vaccine efforts: Adar Poonawalla
news_article: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla told a World Bank panel that a US law blocking export of raw materials, including bags and filters, will hamper global vaccination efforts. "The Novavax vaccine, which we're a major manufacturer for, needs these items from...US," he added. The US government had invoked the Defense Production Act to prioritise supplies for Pfizer vaccine.

news_headline: Will lift ban on Trump when risk of violence decreases: YouTube CEO
news_article: YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki has said the platform will lift its ban on former US President Donald Trump after the "risk of violence" has decreased. She said YouTube will look at government warnings and violent rhetoric to determine when it's safe to lift the suspension. YouTube had suspended Trump's channel post the US Capitol violence on January 6.

news_headline: Path to NASA started after watching Star Trek as a child: Swati Mohan to Biden
news_article: Swati Mohan, who leads the guidance, navigation, and control operations of NASA's Mars 2020 mission, told US President Joe Biden that her path to NASA began when she watched Star Trek's first episode as a child. "What captured my attention was this really close-knit team working together...with the sole purpose of exploring space and understanding new things," she said.

news_headline: Farmers' protest is India's internal matter: UK govt ahead of debate in Parliament
news_article: Farmers' protest was India's "internal matter" and was for India to resolve, the new British High Commissioner to India Alex Ellis said. He said this ahead of a UK Parliament debate on press freedom and safety of protesters in India, scheduled for next Monday. Things happening in India have ripples in UK because of a large Indian diaspora, Ellis said.

news_headline: Indian-Americans are taking over the US: Joe Biden
news_article: While interacting with Swati Mohan, in charge of landing Perseverance rover on Mars, and other NASA scientists, US President Joe Biden said, "Indian-of-descent Americans are taking over the country." "This is an incredible honour," Biden said while talking to Mohan. In less than 50 days of his presidency, Biden has appointed at least 55 Indian-Americans to key leadership positions.

news_headline: Pak PM to seek vote of confidence on March 6 after Senate election setback
news_article: Pakistan PM Imran Khan will seek a confidence vote in the National Assembly, or parliament's lower house, on March 6. Khan's call for a vote of confidence comes a day after Finance Minister Abdul Hafeez Shaikh was defeated from the Islamabad seat in the Senate elections. Shaikh lost to Yousaf Raza Gillani. Khan had personally campaigned for his Cabinet colleague.

news_headline: Tsunami warning issued after 7.3 magnitude earthquake hits New Zealand
news_article: An earthquake of magnitude 7.3 struck New Zealand, triggering warnings of a possible tsunami. "We have issued a TSUNAMI WARNING for New Zealand coastal areas following the magnitude 7.3 earthquake near EAST OF THE NORTH ISLAND NEW ZEALAND. There is a LAND and MARINE TSUNAMI THREAT," tweeted New Zealand's National Emergency Management Agency.

news_headline: Pakistan PM Imran Khan forgets sentence during speech, gets trolled
news_article: While addressing Pakistan a day after suffering a setback in the Senate election, Pakistan PM Imran Khan forgot what he was saying during the speech. "Yeh jo sare PDM ke...inke jo...ye jo bade bade...kya hain ye? jo bhi hai," he was heard saying. Trolling him, a Twitter user wrote, "Bade bade shehron mein aisi choti choti baatein hoti rehti hain."

news_headline: 17% of the food produced globally each year is wasted: UN report
news_article: A UN report estimates 17% of the food produced globally each year is wasted, which amounts to 931 million metric tons of food. Most of the waste (61%) happens in households, while food services account for 26% and retailers account for 13% of wastage. The food discarded in homes alone was 74 kg per person each year on an average.

news_headline: Threesome sex made me better cope with depression: Trump's ex-lawyer's daughter
news_article: Caroline Giuliani, daughter of Donald Trump's former lawyer Rudy Giuliani, has written about exploring her sexuality in a magazine. The 31-year-old filmmaker wrote she shed her shame about her curiosity and sense of adventure after she started having threesome sex with couples. She added it helped her "better cope with depression, anxiety, and lingering cognitive effects of adolescent anorexia".

news_headline: Use cheap oil you bought last year: Saudi as India asks OPEC to ease output cuts
news_article: Saudi Energy Minister Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman has said that India should use the crude that it purchased "very cheaply last year". His comments came after India urged the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) to ease production curbs and fulfil their promise of stable oil prices. On Thursday, OPEC and its allies extended output cuts till April.

news_headline: 19 Myanmar police officers cross into India seeking refuge: Reports
news_article: At least nineteen Myanmar police officers have crossed over into India and are seeking refuge there, a senior police official told Reuters. The men crossed into Champhai and Serchhip, two districts in the northeastern state of Mizoram that share a porous border with Myanmar, the official said. All the men, who are lower-ranking policemen, were unarmed, the official added.

news_headline: Brazil's 2nd-biggest city announces curfew to curb COVID-19 spread
news_article: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil's second-biggest city, will impose a night curfew and restrict certain businesses to curb the spread of coronavirus, according to information published in the city's official bulletin on Thursday. Over the past few days, several states and cities, including the country's capital Brasília, have announced restrictions amid rising COVID-19 cases.

news_headline: Zimbabwe becomes 1st in Africa to approve Bharat Biotech's Covaxin
news_article: Zimbabwe has become the first African country to approve Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, India's indigenous COVID-19 vaccine, for use. "Trying to get it to Zimbabwe at an early date," the Indian Embassy in Zimbabwe tweeted. This comes after Bharat Biotech said that the vaccine has an 81% interim efficacy in preventing COVID-19 in those without prior infection after the second dose.

news_headline: New COVID-19 cases rising in Europe after 6 weeks of decline: WHO
news_article: The number of new coronavirus cases in Europe rose by 9% last week after declining for six weeks, the WHO said. "We're seeing a resurgence in central and Eastern Europe. New cases are also on...rise in several western European countries where rates were already high," it added. The WHO called for an accelerated roll-out of COVID-19 vaccines in Europe.

news_headline: YouTube removes 5 channels run by Myanmar's military for violations
news_article: YouTube has removed five channels run by Myanmar's military for violating its community guidelines and terms of service. The removal follows the military coup that ousted Myanmar's elected government, leading to public protests. YouTube has said it is monitoring the situation for any content that might violate its rules.

news_headline: B'desh central to India's neighbourhood 1st policy: Jaishankar in Dhaka
news_article: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday reached Bangladesh ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the country and held talks with Bangladesh Foreign Minister AK Abdul Momen. He said Bangladesh is central to India's neighbourhood first policy. "The largest number of vaccines shipped by India to any foreign country so far, 9 million, has been to Bangladesh," Jaishankar added.

news_headline: HK court keeps 15 activists in custody despite granting them bail
news_article: A Hong Kong court had ordered all 47 pro-democracy activists charged under the national security law to be kept in custody after government prosecutors appealed an initial decision to grant 15 of them bail. The activists have been charged with conspiracy to commit subversion. Thirty-one activists were denied bail by the court, while one activist withdrew his bail application.

news_headline: Ties with China biggest geopolitical test of 21st century: US
news_article: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has said that America's relationship with China is "the biggest geopolitical test of the 21st century". China is the only country with the economic, diplomatic, military and technological power to seriously challenge the stable and open international system, he added. Russia, Iran and North Korea present serious challenges to the US, he further said.

news_headline: Military helicopter crashes in eastern Turkey, 9 soldiers killed
news_article: Turkey said that nine soldiers were killed and four others were injured after one of its military helicopters crashed in the country's eastern region on Thursday. The injured soldiers were being evacuated to a hospital, it added. The Turkish Defence Ministry described the incident as an accident, but it wasn't immediately known what caused the crash.

news_headline: 4 Congress leaders in Rahul's constituency in Kerala quit party
news_article: Ahead of the Assembly elections in Kerala, four Congress leaders in Rahul Gandhi's constituency Wayanad have left the party in the past one week. KPCC Secretary MS Viswanathan, Mahila Congress state Secretary Sujaya Venugopal, PK Anil Kumar who was the General Secretary of Indian National Trade Union Congress and KPCC member KK Viswanathan are the leaders who resigned.

news_headline: Minister retracts statement after saying E Sreedharan will be BJP's Kerala CM face
news_article: Union Minister V Muraleedharan has retracted his statement after tweeting, "Kerala BJP will fight Kerala polls with E Sreedharanji as its chief ministerial candidate." Muraleedharan stated, "What I wanted to tell was that through media reports I learnt that the party has made this announcement. Later, I cross-checked with the party chief who said he hasn't made any such announcement."

news_headline: Rahul violated Model Code, restrain him from campaigning in TN: BJP to EC
news_article: Ahead of the Assembly elections, Tamil Nadu BJP President L Murugan has written to the Election Commission requesting it to restrain Congress leader Rahul Gandhi from campaigning in the state. Referring to Rahul's interaction with students during recent state visit, Murugan alleged that the leader violated the Model Code of Conduct by "inciting the youth to another freedom struggle".

news_headline: Bengal CM to fight from Nandigram in polls; to vacate Bhawanipore seat
news_article: The Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Friday released its list of 291 candidates for the West Bengal Assembly elections scheduled to begin from March 27 onwards. CM Mamata Banerjee said she will be fighting from Nandigram instead of her current constituency of Bhawanipore in Kolkata. She added, "My party colleague Sobhandeb Chattopadhyay will be fighting from Bhawanipore seat."

news_headline: AIADMK releases list of 6 candidates for TN polls; CM to fight from Edappadi
news_article: The AIADMK has released its first list of six candidates for Tamil Nadu Assembly elections scheduled for April 6. Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami will contest in the upcoming polls from the Edappadi constituency in his home district of Salem. Deputy CM O Panneerselvam will fight the election from the Bodinayakanur constituency.

news_headline: Cong MLA takes off shirt in K'taka Assembly during protest; suspended
news_article: Congress MLA BK Sangamesh was suspended from attending the House for seven days by Karnataka Assembly Speaker VH Kageri on Thursday for taking off his shirt in the House. He had taken off his shirt as a mark of protest during the 'One Nation One Election' debate. Congress leader DK Shivakumar reportedly urged Sangamesh to put the shirt back on.

news_headline: Suspension of 5 Cong MLAs from Himachal Pradesh Assembly revoked
news_article: The suspension of five Congress MLAs from the Himachal Pradesh Assembly was revoked unanimously on Friday, Speaker Vipin Singh Parmar said. Leader of Opposition Mukesh Agnihotri and MLAs Harshwardhan Chauhan, Satpal Singh Raizada, Sunder Singh Thakur and Vinay Kumar were suspended from the Assembly on February 26 for allegedly manhandling Himachal Pradesh Governor Bandaru Dattatreya.

news_headline: Mumbai's Karachi Bakery shuts down; MNS leader takes credit
news_article: Karachi Bakery in Mumbai has shut down after months of protests by MNS leaders over its name. The shop's manager said they closed the shop over drop in business. However, MNS leader Haji Saif Shaikh tweeted, "After massive protest on Karachi Bakery for its name Karachi led by Vice President of MNS (Shaikh) karachi bakery finally closes its...shop in Mumbai."

news_headline: Farooq Abdullah dances to Bollywood song at Punjab CM's granddaughter's wedding
news_article: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah was seen dancing to Bollywood song 'Aaj Kal Tere Mere Pyaar Ke Charche' at Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh's granddaughter Seherinder Kaur's wedding. Reacting to a video that went viral, Congress leader Saral Patel tweeted, "This video of @capt_amarinder & Farooq Abdullah proves that age is, indeed, just a number!"

news_headline: UP Police announce ₹25,000 reward on ex-MP Dhananjay Singh in murder case
news_article: Uttar Pradesh Police have announced a cash reward of ₹25,000 on former BSP MP Dhananjay Singh, who is accused of conspiracy in the murder of former block pramukh Ajit Singh in Mau district. Police have raided four locations but he could not be found, DCP (Eastern) Sanjiv Suman said. Ajit Singh was shot dead in January this year.

news_headline: India still high up on BJP's Yogimeter: Mahua Moitra on freedom ranking
news_article: Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra has reacted to India getting ranked "partly free" in terms of freedom by a Washington-based think tank. "India's democracy under siege, only 'partly free' according to Freedom House but hey, what do US based non-profits know anyway? India still high up on BJP's Yogimeter," Moitra tweeted. Finland and Norway are among the most free countries.

news_headline: Maharashtra Guv accepts Forest Minister Sanjay Rathod's resignation
news_article: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari accepted the resignation of state Forest Minister Sanjay Rathod on Thursday, four days after he had resigned. Rathod, who has been linked to TikTok star Pooja Chavan's death, had tendered his resignation to CM Uddhav Thackeray on February 28. On Wednesday, the BJP had alleged that his resignation was not forwarded to the Governor.

news_headline: TMC seeks removal of EC's Bengal in-charge, says he is 'tilted towards BJP'
news_article: Rajya Sabha MP and TMC leader Derek O'Brien has sought the removal of Deputy Election Commissioner who is in-charge of West Bengal, Sudeep Jain, and accused him of being "tilted towards BJP".  O'Brien wrote a letter to the Election Commission and alleged, "We have serious doubt that Shri Sudeep Jain would be impartial...We have no confidence."

news_headline: Anurag Kashyap, Taapsee paid for speaking for farmers: Shiv Sena
news_article: An editorial in Shiv Sena's mouthpiece 'Saamana' has said that filmmaker Anurag Kashyap and actress Taapsee Pannu are "among the handful of people who stood by the farmers' agitation" and that "they are paying the price for it". The editorial follows the Income Tax raids conducted on Kashyap's and Taapsee Pannu's properties in Mumbai on Wednesday.

news_headline: Reconsider COVID-19 vaccine charges in private hospitals: Siddaramaiah
news_article: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has urged PM Narendra Modi to reconsider the decision to allow private hospitals to charge ₹250 for administering the COVID-19 vaccine. It will "adversely impact" the fight against COVID-19, he said. "The office of Prime Minister has failed to release accounts of the PM-CARES Fund and also failed to provide vaccination at zero cost," Siddaramaiah added.

news_headline: Unprecedented: Fadnavis on vacant Maha Assembly Speaker post
news_article: Former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said, "It has never happened before that despite the Governor's recommendation, the post of Assembly Speaker is vacant for over a week." He added, "This is equivalent to the failure of constitutional machinery." The post fell vacant after Nana Patole resigned as Speaker on February 4 and took over as Congress' Maharashtra chief.

news_headline: Centre pushing people into morass of inflation to earn tax: Rahul
news_article: Terming inflation a "curse", Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that the "central government is only pushing the people into the morass of inflation to earn tax". Gandhi further urged people to raise their voices against rising prices. Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra also said that the NDA government has sidelined the issues faced by the common man.

news_headline: AIUDF communal, can't take it along to oppose BJP in Assam: Akhil Gogoi
news_article: Jailed peasants' activist Akhil Gogoi, in a letter to opposition parties, has urged that only a joint candidate be put up against the BJP in the upcoming Assam Assembly polls. Gogoi said he was not counting Badruddin Ajmal's AIUDF among the opposition parties. "We don't desire to take along a communal party with fundamentalist ideology," Gogoi wrote.

news_headline: In talks with 'like-minded' parties for alliance: MNM chief Kamal Haasan
news_article: Veteran actor and Makkal Needhi Maiam (MNM) founder Kamal Haasan on Wednesday said that he's in talks with "like-minded" parties for a possible electoral alliance ahead of Assembly elections on April 6. "Many parties are holding discussions and some like AISMK shook hands. We'll decide on alliance first before a confab on seat-sharing," he added.

news_headline: VCK to contest in 6 seats in Tamil Nadu polls as part of DMK alliance
news_article: Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi (VCK) on Thursday signed a memorandum with the DMK for the upcoming Tamil Nadu Assembly elections to contest in six constituencies. "It's important to go along with DMK...as BJP-RSS are targeting Tamil Nadu and Puducherry in absence of Jayalalithaa," a VCK leader said. He added, "We won't allow them to come to power here."

news_headline: Capgemini to cover COVID-19 vaccination costs of India employees, families
news_article: French IT firm Capgemini on Thursday said that it will cover the cost of COVID-19 vaccination of its employees in India and their dependents who are part of its medical benefits program. The company currently employs about 1.25 lakh people in India. Earlier, Infosys and Accenture also announced that they'll cover the vaccination costs of their employees in India.

news_headline: Chennai researcher gets ₹36 lakh from Microsoft for reporting a bug
news_article: A Chennai-based security researcher has received $50,000 (about ₹36 lakh) from Microsoft for finding a potential vulnerability in their online services. The bug would "have allowed anyone to takeover any Microsoft account without consent permission", Laxman Muthiyah wrote in a blog. Microsoft patched the issue after Muthiyah reported it and awarded him as part of their Identity Bounty Program.

news_headline: It's in Valhalla now: Musk shares slow motion video of exploding Starship rocket
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Friday shared a video showing the landing and subsequent explosion of the company's Starship rocket prototype in slow motion. "SN10 is in Valhalla now," he tweeted with the video. Valhalla is a hall in Norse mythology where Odin, the ruler God of Asgard, sends those who die in combat.

news_headline: RailTel launches prepaid Wi-Fi at 4,000 stations; first 30 mins to be free
news_article: Railway PSU RailTel has launched plans for prepaid Wi-Fi at over 4,000 railway stations. A passenger can use up to 30 minutes of free Wi-Fi per day at 1 Mbps speed. For higher speeds, plans begin from ₹10 for 5 GB in a day, ₹15 for 10 GB in a day and ₹20 for 10 GB valid for five days.

news_headline: They don't have any teeth: SC to Centre on new OTT rules
news_article: The Supreme Court has expressed dissatisfaction about the rules framed by the Centre under the Information Technology Act to regulate Over The Top (OTT) platforms. "These rules don't have any teeth. There's no provision for prosecution or fine. They're only just guidelines," the court said. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta agreed to present a draft legislation in court in two weeks.

news_headline: Robot dog spotted at explosion site of SpaceX's Starship rocket prototype
news_article: SpaceX Boston Dynamics robot dog named "Zeus" was spotted at the space agency's test site, where the company's Starship rocket prototype exploded minutes after landing during a test flight. The video of the yellow coloured four-legged robot has also surfaced. Zeus was inspecting the wreckage of the prototype, according to reports.

news_headline: RIP SN10: Musk as Starship prototype rocket explodes after landing
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Thursday tweeted, "RIP SN10, honorable discharge," after the company's Starship rocket prototype exploded minutes after landing during a test flight. The rocket soared into the sky in a high-altitude test in Texas and then flew itself back and manoeuvred into its first successful upright landing. However, it blew up eight minutes after landing.

news_headline: Will lift ban on Trump when risk of violence decreases: YouTube CEO
news_article: YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki has said the platform will lift its ban on former US President Donald Trump after the "risk of violence" has decreased. She said YouTube will look at government warnings and violent rhetoric to determine when it's safe to lift the suspension. YouTube had suspended Trump's channel post the US Capitol violence on January 6.

news_headline: WhatsApp rolls out voice and video calling for its desktop app
news_article: WhatsApp on Thursday announced it is rolling out voice and video calling support for its desktop app users worldwide. "WhatsApp voice and video calls are end-to-end encrypted, so WhatsApp can't hear or see them, whether you call from your phone or your computer," the company said. WhatsApp is starting with one-to-one calls on the WhatsApp desktop app.

news_headline: Tata Motors to go solo, no tie-up with Tesla for EVs: N Chandrasekaran
news_article: Tata Motors Chairman N Chandrasekaran clarified that there's "no dialogue" with Elon Musk-led Tesla for a partnership in India. "We will do it on our own," he added while speaking of the company's plans for the electric vehicle (EV) segment. In January, a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility had sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla for electric vehicles.

news_headline: Premji's Wipro makes its biggest purchase, buys Capco for $1.45 bn
news_article: Billionaire Azim Premji's IT company Wipro has agreed to acquire London-based consultancy firm Capco for $1.45 billion in its biggest purchase. Capco employs 5,000 consultants and will help the company add banking, insurance and financial services clients, Wipro said. The transaction is expected to close in the quarter ending June 30.

news_headline: Amazon to stream NFL's Thursday Night games exclusively in $1-bn deal: Report
news_article: Amazon and US' National Football League (NFL) are close to signing a deal that gives Amazon exclusive streaming rights to a "significant number" of Thursday Night games on Prime Video, The Wall Street Journal reported. Amazon could reportedly pay up to $1 billion per year for the rights. Amazon-owned Twitch has made deals with the NBA and Formula One.

news_headline: Sony patents tech that turns objects into PlayStation controllers
news_article: Sony has filed a patent application that details a method of turning "non-luminous passive object being held by a user" into a PlayStation controller, GamesIndustry reported. With the example of bananas and oranges, Sony explains how a camera could detect objects so they could be used as controllers or detect user's finger to coincide with the location of virtual button.

news_headline: No govt member in self-regulatory body of OTT platforms: I&B Ministry
news_article: The self-regulatory body formed by over-the-top (OTT) video streaming platforms will not have any member appointed by the government, the Information and Broadcasting Ministry has said. The clarification came during the meeting between I&B Minister Prakash Javadekar and representatives of OTT, following the announcement of digital media guidelines last week.

news_headline: UK starts investigating Apple over alleged anti-competitive behaviour
news_article: UK's competition regulator has started investigating Apple over reports that its App Store terms and conditions are "unfair and could break competition law". The Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) will probe whether Apple has a dominant position in the distribution of apps on Apple devices in UK. Apple charges up to 30% commission from developers for in-app purchases.

news_headline: Myanmar soldiers use TikTok to send death threats to protesters: Report
news_article: Uniformed soldiers in Myanmar are using video sharing app TikTok to deliver death threats to protesters against the coup, digital rights group Myanmar ICT for Development Organization said. The group's executive director said there are hundreds of such videos that remain on the platform without any action from TikTok. The company said it will continue to remove violent content.

news_headline: Apple could face EU chargesheet over Spotify complaint: Report
news_article: Apple could face an antitrust chargesheet by the European Union (EU) in the coming weeks over a 2019 complaint lodged by Spotify, Reuters reported. The charge could force Apple to change its business model. The music streaming service had earlier alleged that Apple unfairly restricts rivals to Apple Music and it also protested Apple's 30% fee for in-app purchases.

news_headline: Amazon to open store with no cashiers in London, its first outside US
news_article: Amazon on Thursday said it is opening a cashier-less convenience store in the UK, marking its first use of its automated checkout technology outside the US. The proposed 2,500-square foot Amazon Fresh store in London will use cameras and sensors to track shoppers as they pull items off the shelves and charge a credit card on file after they exit.

news_headline: Blackstone in talks to acquire minority stake in Sify: Report
news_article: US-based Blackstone Group is in exclusive talks to acquire a minority stake in Chennai's Sify Technologies, Bloomberg reported. Sify has sought a valuation of around $1 billion to $1.2 billion in a transaction. However, it is unclear what valuation the Blackstone stake purchase will be struck at and the talks between the firms could still fall apart.

news_headline: SpaceX launches 60 Starlink satellites marking 20th successful mission
news_article: Elon Musk-led space agency SpaceX on Thursday launched another 60 Starlink satellites into Earth's low orbit, marking its 20th successful Starlink mission. The satellites were launched atop SpaceX's reusable Falcon 9 rocket. SpaceX is targetting to launch its satellite internet in India in 2022 and has begun accepting pre-orders for the same at a deposit of $99 (about ₹ 7,300).

news_headline: It's in Valhalla now: Musk shares slow motion video of exploding Starship rocket
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Friday shared a video showing the landing and subsequent explosion of the company's Starship rocket prototype in slow motion. "SN10 is in Valhalla now," he tweeted with the video. Valhalla is a hall in Norse mythology where Odin, the ruler God of Asgard, sends those who die in combat.

news_headline: Robot dog spotted at explosion site of SpaceX's Starship rocket prototype
news_article: SpaceX Boston Dynamics robot dog named "Zeus" was spotted at the space agency's test site, where the company's Starship rocket prototype exploded minutes after landing during a test flight. The video of the yellow coloured four-legged robot has also surfaced. Zeus was inspecting the wreckage of the prototype, according to reports.

news_headline: SpaceX engineers were left without food on an island in early days: Book
news_article: Elon Musk-led SpaceX's rocket engineers lived on a Pacific island in the company's early days where they occasionally ran out of food, new book 'Liftoff' by reporter Eric Berger claimed. A revolt was also staged by the hungry workers in 2005. On that island, called Omelek, the team was building a launchpad and setting up the Falcon 1 rocket.

news_headline: RIP SN10: Musk as Starship prototype rocket explodes after landing
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk on Thursday tweeted, "RIP SN10, honorable discharge," after the company's Starship rocket prototype exploded minutes after landing during a test flight. The rocket soared into the sky in a high-altitude test in Texas and then flew itself back and manoeuvred into its first successful upright landing. However, it blew up eight minutes after landing.

news_headline: Elon Musk plans to rename SpaceX's Texas launch site to 'Starbase'
news_article: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk is planning to rename its Texas launch site to 'Starbase' after the company's Starship rocket. "Creating the city of Starbase, Texas," Musk tweeted. A SpaceX representative made a "casual inquiry" with local authorities about the requirements to incorporate the launch site, Boca Chica Village, and rename it to Starbase.

news_headline: You played 'Narad' to block Reliance-Future deal: Distributors to Bezos
news_article: All India Consumer Products Distributors Federation (AICPDF) wrote to Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos to not block the over ₹24,000-crore Reliance-Future Group deal and compared him to Narad Muni. "You decided to play Narad and blocked this deal," the distributors said to Bezos. They claim 6,000 members have dues of ₹6,000 crore from Future Group pending since March last year.

news_headline: Prototype of SpaceX's biggest rocket Starship explodes after landing in test flight
news_article: A prototype of SpaceX's biggest rocket Starship exploded shortly after landing for the first time following a high-altitude flight test. The cause of the explosion, or whether it was intentional, was not immediately clear. Elon Musk first celebrated the landing, saying, "Starship SN10 landed in one piece" and then tweeted, "RIP SN10, honorable discharge."

news_headline: Jack Dorsey's Square acquires majority stake in Jay-Z's TIDAL for $297 mn
news_article: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey's financial payments company Square is acquiring a majority stake in music streaming company TIDAL, owned by artists like Jay-Z, Beyoncé and Rihanna. "I'm grateful for Jay's vision, wisdom, and leadership. I knew TIDAL was something special as soon as I experienced it," Dorsey wrote. As part of the $297 million deal, Jay-Z will join Square's board.

news_headline: Mark Cuban's basketball team to accept Dogecoin as payment
news_article: Billionaire Mark Cuban told DealBook that his basketball team Dallas Mavericks has decided to accept the meme-inspired cryptocurrency Dogecoin as payment. Cuban added, "Sometimes in business, you have to do things that are fun." Cuban recently tweeted that he bought Dogecoin to teach his son about investing. The NBA team has been accepting payments in Bitcoin since 2019.

news_headline: Google's AI lab DeepMind considered launching a food division: Report
news_article: Google AI lab DeepMind was in talks with food startup Hampton Creek to launch an AI-powered food supplements division, reported Business Insider. Proposals for a 'nutricube', a square vitamin supplement customers could add to meals to improve their nutritional content, were also reportedly discussed. The plan was abandoned after internal disputes over the value of the project, among other reasons.

news_headline: SpaceX to build new factory for Starlink in Texas
news_article: Elon Musk-led SpaceX is building a new factory in Texas for its satellite-based internet service Starlink, as per a job posting from the company. The company in the posting said it is "breaking ground on a new, state-of-the-art" manufacturing facility in Austin, Texas to keep up with global demand. Musk has also moved to Texas from California.

news_headline: Peter Thiel-backed psychedelic biotech firm worth $2 bn with $157 mn funding
news_article: Atai Life Sciences, a psychedelic biotech company backed by billionaire investor Peter Thiel, on Wednesday announced it had raised a $157 million funding round. Reuters and Bloomberg reported that the funding came at a $2 billion valuation. The company works on the development of psychedelics and other drugs to treat mental illnesses including depression and anxiety.

news_headline: SpaceX launches 60 Starlink satellites marking 20th successful mission
news_article: Elon Musk-led space agency SpaceX on Thursday launched another 60 Starlink satellites into Earth's low orbit, marking its 20th successful Starlink mission. The satellites were launched atop SpaceX's reusable Falcon 9 rocket. SpaceX is targetting to launch its satellite internet in India in 2022 and has begun accepting pre-orders for the same at a deposit of $99 (about ₹ 7,300).

news_headline: Air taxi startup Volocopter raises $241 mn, says operations to begin in 2 yrs
news_article: German air taxi startup Volocopter has raised about $241 million in Series D funding. CEO Florian Reuter said services for its two vehicle models, VoloDrone and VoloCity, will begin in about two years. "Paris and Singapore are in pole position [as the first cities], where Paris wants to have electric air taxis established for the 2024 Olympics," he said.

news_headline: We need to ensure startups aren't afraid of failure: Piyush Goyal
news_article: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal at the Global Bio-India Startup Conclave said it needs to be ensured that startups aren't afraid of failure. He further said failure needs to be celebrated because "when somebody fails, he knows how not to do something". "Our startups need to be encouraged to experiment, to go beyond the run-of-the-mill thinking," he added.

news_headline: Used smartphone reseller Cashify raises $15 million
news_article: Re-commerce marketplace for used smartphones Cashify has raised $15 million from US-based Olympus Capital Asia's Asia Environmental Partners. Founded by Mandeep Manocha, Nakul Kumar and Amit Sethi, Cashify provides refurbished devices like smartphones, laptops, desktops, tablets and gaming consoles, with smartphones accounting for 90% of its business. The startup was founded in 2013.

news_headline: SpaceX, NASA to launch 2nd Commercial Crew Rotation Mission to ISS
news_article: Elon Musk-led SpaceX and NASA are going to launch the second Commercial Crew Rotation Mission to the International Space Station (ISS). The mission will carry two NASA astronauts, one JAXA astronaut and one ESA astronaut aboard SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft. The mission has been scheduled to lift off on April 20 from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida.

news_headline: IPO-bound Policybazaar receives investment from Bay Capital
news_article: Insurance aggregator Policybazaar's holding company PB Fintech has received investment from UK-based Bay Capital ahead of its initial public offering (IPO). Policybazaar aims to launch its IPO in the next 12 to 15 months. Policybazaar became a unicorn in 2018 after it raised its Series F funding which was led by Japan's SoftBank.

news_headline: Zomato to raise up to $1B in IPO, investors unlikely to exit: Report
news_article: Zomato is likely to raise between $750 million to $1 billion through its initial public offering (IPO), the Economic Times reported. Quoting CEO Deepinder Goyal's meeting with Zomato employees, the publication reported that the IPO will be a 100% primary issue and its existing investors will be unlikely to exit or partly sell their stake to public market investors.

news_headline: Walmart's Flipkart considers listing in US via SPAC merger: Report
news_article: Walmart-owned Flipkart is considering going public and listing in the US through a merger with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC), reported Bloomberg. Flipkart could reportedly seek a valuation of $35 billion in a blank-cheque transaction. Grofers is also reportedly exploring a SPAC merger, while Gurugram-based ReNew Power last week agreed to a SPAC merger for listing in the US.

news_headline: Taapsee's boyfriend tweets to Sports Minister about I-T raid, Rijiju responds
news_article: Sports Minister Kiren Rijiju has responded to Taapsee Pannu's boyfriend, badminton coach Mathias Boe's tweet about I-T raids on Taapsee. "Representing India...as...coach, meanwhile I-T department is raiding Taapsee's houses...@KirenRijiju please do something," wrote Mathias. "Law of...land is supreme...Subject matter is beyond [our] domain. We must stick to...professional duties," Rijiju replied.

news_headline: SC grants protection from arrest to Amazon’s Aparna Purohit in 'Tandav' FIRs
news_article: The Supreme Court on Friday granted interim protection from arrest to Amazon Prime Video's head of India Originals Aparna Purohit in connection with FIRs against her over the web series 'Tandav'. The protection is subject to Purohit cooperating with the investigation and appearing before police when summoned. She had challenged Allahabad High Court's order denying her anticipatory bail.

news_headline: My girlfriend & I were scared to tell even female friends: Shonali on bisexuality
news_article: Director Shonali Bose has revealed she discovered her bisexuality after she happened to meet a girl who came to India on an education programme. "Six months of being with her and we realised we were in love....We...acknowledged it, but were scared to tell even our woman friends," she added. "I'm genuinely at ease with both men and women," stated Shonali.

news_headline: Gauahar Khan's father passes away, actress pens note
news_article: Actress Gauahar Khan's father Zafar Ahmed Khan passed away after being admitted to a hospital in Mumbai for several days. Sharing a note on Instagram, the actress wrote, "I am so much of you Pappa. And yet can never ever be even a percent of your magnanimous personality." Gauahar's husband Zaid Darbar wrote, "Please keep my father-in-law in your Duaa."

news_headline: I was really unhappy with myself, lost 14-kg weight during lockdown: Vivek Oberoi
news_article: Actor Vivek Oberoi, in a recent interview, said that he was really unhappy with himself after he gained a lot of weight due to his unhealthy lifestyle. He added, "Thanks to the lockdown, it forced me to look inward. I followed a strict regimen...I went on a juice diet and cleansed my system...I was able to lose 14-kg weight."

news_headline: Chargesheet filed in drug case related to Sushant's death, 33 named accused
news_article: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) today filed a chargesheet in drug case related to Sushant Singh Rajput's death. The chargesheet has named 33 accused, including Rhea Chakraborty. It also includes statements of over 200 witnesses. "More than 12,000 pages in hard copy and about 50,000 pages in digital format submitted in court today," the NCB said.

news_headline: Rannvijay Singha announces wife's second pregnancy, shares pic with baby bump
news_article: Actor Rannvijay Singha has announced his wife Prianka's second pregnancy. Rannvijay took to Instagram to share a picture wherein he can be seen holding his wife's baby bump. The picture also includes Rannvijay and Prianka's daughter Kainaat Singha, who was born in 2017. "Missing the three of you so much," he captioned the picture.

news_headline: Content will continue to exist: Rana on theatres vs OTT debate
news_article: Commenting on the digital platforms versus theatres debate, Rana Daggubati said, "There will be specific...stories that you'll watch on OTT and there will be specific experiences you'll go to the theatre for." He added, "Content will continue to exist, whether it's in cinema halls or on OTT. Cinema halls will always be the place for spectacle story experiences."

news_headline: It'll be different: Lupita on filming 'Black Panther 2' without Boseman
news_article: Speaking about filming 'Black Panther 2' without late actor Chadwick Boseman, who played the lead character in the first film, actress Lupita Nyong'o said, "It's gonna be different...without our king to go back into that world." She said on 'Good Morning America', "Ryan Coogler [director] has some...exciting ideas that I look forward to bringing to life."

news_headline: Will get married only after Salman Khan: Singer Mika Singh
news_article: Singer Mika Singh, in an episode of the reality show Indian Pro Music League, spoke about his marriage plans and jokingly said, "I will get married only after Salman Khan gets married." He added, "As Sajid (Khan) bhai mentioned earlier, I'm the only forever bachelor in...industry after Salman bhai and I'd like to keep the tag...for as long as possible."

news_headline: We create movies for the audience alone: 'Drishyam' star Mohanlal
news_article: During a recent interview, 'Drishyam 2' actor Mohanlal said, "[I have] learned and maintained that we should present stories with all our heart and dedication." He added, "Audience is the king when it comes to any movie. We create such movies for them alone. So, it is important that they like what we present."

news_headline: Vin Diesel's 'F9' postponed, film to hit theatres on June 25
news_article: The release of Vin Diesel's 'F9', the ninth instalment in the 'Fast & Furious' franchise, has been postponed. The film, which was supposed to release on May 28, will now hit the theatres on June 25. The Justin Lin directorial was originally scheduled for release on May 22, 2020, but was delayed multiple times due to the coronavirus pandemic.

news_headline: Fatima Sana Shaikh to star in Hindi remake of Tamil film 'Aruvi'
news_article: Fatima Sana Shaikh will play the lead role in the Hindi remake of the Tamil film 'Aruvi'. The film will be directed by E Niwas, who won the National Film Award for 1999 film 'Shool'. Talking about her upcoming project, Fatima said, "I'm...thrilled to do...remake of 'Aruvi' and really looking forward to diving deep into the skin of the character."

news_headline: Jasmin Bhasin, Aly Goni to star in Tony Kakkar's music video
news_article: Bigg Boss 14's Jasmin Bhasin and Aly Goni will star together in singer Tony Kakkar's upcoming music video titled 'Tera Suit'. Tony made the announcement on Twitter and shared that the song will release on March 8. Last year, Tony's 'Shona Shona' music video featured former Bigg Boss contestants Sidharth Shukla and Shehnaaz Gill.

news_headline: To always being partners: Sonam wishes sister Rhea on her b'day
news_article: Actress Sonam Kapoor took to Instagram to wish her sister Rhea Kapoor on her birthday by posting a series of pictures with her. In the caption, she wrote, "Happy...birthday to my soulmate/best friend/sister Rhea. [The] first birthday I've missed because of this ridiculous time. I love you so much and [I] miss you more. To always being partners and sisters."

news_headline: I promise to always irritate you: Sara on brother Ibrahim's b'day
news_article: Actress Sara Ali Khan posted a series of pictures with her brother Ibrahim Ali Khan on Instagram to mark his birthday on Friday and wrote, "Happy birthday Iggy Potter." She added, "I promise to always make you the best coffee...feed you with pyaar [love], irritate you always...be the worst google maps navigator and tell the best knock-knock jokes."

news_headline: It brought Rubina and me close: Abhinav on Rakhi pulling his drawstrings
news_article: Bigg Boss 14's Abhinav Shukla has revealed that the incident of Rakhi Sawant pulling at his drawstrings on the reality show, brought him closer to his wife Rubina Dilaik. Speaking about Rubina's response to the incident, he told The Times of India, "It became an instinctive response that thereafter, we'll watch each other's back...It gave me a sense of belonging."

news_headline: There's still a lot of risk: Kunal Kemmu on theatrical releases
news_article: Speaking about theatres opening up and filmmakers announcing the theatrical release of their movies, actor Kunal Kemmu said, "How comfortable will people be to go to theatres right now? There's still a lot of risk as everyone hasn't [gotten vaccinated]." He added, "We'll have to wait and gauge the appetite of audiences to watch films on the big screen."

news_headline: 'Mission Majnu' has given me butterflies of a debutante again: Rashmika
news_article: South Indian actress Rashmika Mandanna has joined the shoot of her Bollywood debut film 'Mission Majnu' in Lucknow. Speaking about the film, she said, "Mission Majnu has given me the opportunity of feeling...nervousness, excitement and butterflies of a debutante all over again." She added, "I'm thrilled to be part of such amazing content and...really looking forward to this exciting journey."

news_headline: Love the look: Saina Nehwal praises Parineeti's look in 'Saina'
news_article: Indian shuttler Saina Nehwal on Friday praised Parineeti Chopra's look in the upcoming biopic titled 'Saina'. She took to social media to share a screenshot from the teaser and wrote, "Woww this is superb...love the look as mini Saina." The film, which is directed by Amole Gupte, will feature Paresh Rawal as Saina's father and Manav Kaul as her coach.

news_headline: CRED member wins Mercedes-Benz GLC Coupé for paying credit card bill
news_article: CRED, the member-exclusive credit card bill payment app, featured the winner of their Mercedes-Benz GLC Coupé in a new video. Sangeeta Khanna, a celebrity makeup artist from Mumbai, was originally announced as the raffle's lucky winner on November 9, 2020, the company revealed. She had claimed tickets for the raffle by paying her credit card bills on time.

news_headline: Ali Fazal challenges Badshah in new Adda52 ad film
news_article: Watch the fun that ensues as Ali Fazal tries rapping and challenges Badshah to try acting in new ad film, online poker site Adda52 said, adding that both artists feel playing online poker is the 'Asli Challenge' that teaches you to ace life. You too can take inspiration from these stars and learn why they feel this way, it said.

news_headline: Make fitness convenient, affordable & flexible with OnePass: Fitternity
news_article: With Fitternity's OnePass, you can become a member at 5,000+ gyms and studios with just one membership. OnePass gives access to gyms, including those at 5 star hotels and classes like Zumba, Cross Functional Training, Yoga, Pilates and more. In these COVID-19 times, you can buy a OnePass stress free with a 100% membership freezing policy.

news_headline: Don Beardo brings in offers you can’t refuse: Beardo
news_article: After featuring Hrithik Roshan in a never seen before Don avatar, Beardo said that on public demand it is now opening its doors to the mega Beardo Mafia Sale. Promising to stay true to the larger than life style, not only is Beardo offering exciting discounts, they are also giving away one Mahindra Thar to a lucky winner.

news_headline: Sundays are funnier with Bingo! Comedy Adda on Star Plus: Bingo!
news_article: Bingo! is bringing celebs like Ranveer Singh, Bhuvan Bam, Aparshakti Khurana, Harbhajan Singh and Sumeet Vyas on Star Plus, every Sunday at 10:30PM. Viewers will be able to see celebrities falling prey to RJ Naved's pranks and the best comedians doing stand-ups. The show is aired every Sunday on Star Plus & 9 more Star Network Channels.

news_headline: Get ₹1 crore life cover at ₹15/day*: Canara HSBC OBC Life Insurance
news_article: With Canara HSBC OBC Life Insurance, play "Life ka powerplay" when planning for your financial future, the company said. Choose iSelect Star term plan to get life cover till you turn 99* & pay for 10 years*. Save up to 35%* on payable premiums & income tax up to ₹46,800*, options available for 100% return of premium*, the company added.

news_headline: Ranbir in never-seen-before avatar in Ultima Protek TVC: Asian Paints
news_article: Asian Paints new TVC for exterior paint with lamination guard technology, Ultima Protek, features Ranbir Kapoor in a double role playing a matchmaker role. Asian Paints mentions that the campaign focuses on how a house laminated with Ultima Protek stays protected from Baarish, Dhoop & Dhool. Ultima Protek exterior paint comes with a 10-year* warranty.

news_headline: Badshah issues an 'Asli Challenge' to Ali Fazal in new Adda52 ad film
news_article: In the new Adda52 ad film, actor Ali Fazal is seen trying his hand at rapping and challenging rapper Badshah to act. Both soon realise that the 'asli' challenge is in playing online poker at Adda52.com - the game changer to help you ace the game of life via the presence of mind and astute strategy, online poker site Adda52 said.

news_headline: boAt celebrates female individuality, launches new audio lifestyle range
news_article: boAt believes it's time to go beyond the 'women-can-run the-show' conversations and enable women to explore more, celebrate her individuality, and live unrestrained. Drawing strength from brand values, it's celebrating Indian women and has come up with new collection of audio products. There's a shift from women being told what to do, to them writing their own rules, it said.

news_headline: Celebrate the finest moments of life at Elysian, OGC, says Oberoi Realty
news_article: Oberoi Realty's latest project, 'Elysian' boasts of lavish 3-4 BHK in Oberoi Garden City, Goregaon (E)'. "Elysian's spacious interiors, best in class amenities, innovative WFH spaces and OGC ecosystem stands for those moments of happiness which defines the purpose of all our endeavours. Life is worth it when you live it at Elysian", the real estate company added.

news_headline: German prison changes 600 locks after intern shares keys' pic with friends
news_article: JVA Heidering prison in Germany was forced to change 600 locks after an intern shared a picture of the keys with friends on WhatsApp. The trainee who was not named wanted to 'show off how great his new job was', according to reports. Experts estimated that it would have cost the prison €50,000 (around ₹43 lakh) to replace the locks.

news_headline: 4,000-kg unidentified sea creature with no face found on beach in Wales, pics surface
news_article: An unidentified sea creature that weighs 4,000 kg, stretches over 23 feet in length and has no face washed up on a beach in Wales. The creature was found on Broad Haven South Beach in Pembrokeshire last week and reported to the UK Cetacean Strandings Investigation Programme (CSIP). The officials said that the creature had been dead for a while.

news_headline: Van Gogh painting of Paris street goes on display for 1st time
news_article: A rare painting by Vincent van Gogh of a Paris street is being publicly displayed for the first time before its auction. Sotheby's auction house said the work, painted in 1887, has remained in the same family collection for more than 100 years, out of the public eye. Sotheby's has estimated the painting's value between ₹44 crore and ₹71 crore.

news_headline: Canada man does Bhangra on frozen lake after getting Covid-19 vaccine; video viral
